1. A football match is played by two teams, with each allowed no more than 11 players on the field at any one time, one of whom is a goalkeeper.
2. A match is played in two 45 minute halves.
6. If the ball completely crosses the side line, it is thrown back in by the team that was not the last to touch the ball.
5. The aim of the game is to score a goal, which is achieved by kicking or heading the ball into the opposition team\'s goal.
4. All players must use their feet head or chest to play the ball. Only the goalkeeper is allowed to use their hands, and only within their designated goal area.
3. The game begins with the toss of a coin, and the winning captain decides which goal to defend or to take the first kick off.
1. Players move the ball around the court using dribbling, passing, tapping, rolling, and throwing techniques.
2. Each player can take two taps before the ball hits the ground, a basket, a backboard or another player.
3. the most important rule is that you are not allowed to run with the ball.
4. Players must pass the ball to a teammate or shoot for goal after putting two hands on the ball (not including catching it).
5. Winning possession of the ball in your own half means you must travel over the half way line within 10 seconds to avoid a foul.
